The spores formed by this bacterium are oval-shaped and can withstand harsh conditions, such as high temperatures, desiccation, and exposure to chemicals.

Cytobacillus kochii is an aerobic bacterium, meaning it requires oxygen for its metabolic processes. It is capable of utilizing a variety of organic compounds as carbon and energy sources, including carbohydrates, amino acids, and organic acids. The bacterium is known to be involved in the decomposition of organic matter in soil, playing a role in nutrient cycling.

The genome of Cytobacillus kochii has been sequenced, providing insights into its genetic makeup and potential metabolic capabilities. Further research on this species may contribute to our understanding of its ecological roles and potential applications in various fields, such as bioremediation or industrial processes.
